parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To put on, clothe (another). From en and duno; to invest with clothing.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Complete armor, panoply. From a compound of pas and hoplon; full armor.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.
A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From diaballo; a traducer; specially, Satan.
From a compound of meta and hodeuo; travelling over, i.e. Travesty.
